However, good electroencephalographic reactivity is noted in response to nociceptive stimuli, with an association with a dominant posterior rhythmic outline in the alpha band. b bursts of generalized rhythmic delta activity (grda) with bifrontal accentuation, occurring intermittently throughout the tracing during sleep, consisting of stereotyped waves in the 2.0 to 2.5 Hz band. Conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. The findings are compatible with moderate diffuse encephalopathy, of a nonspecific nature in relation to the previous tracing; significant improvement is noted, with mitigation of grda and suppression of stimulus-induced generalized epileptogenesis. electroencephalogram 02/01: slight symmetrical disorganization of the baseline activity due to the slowing of the dominant posterior rhythm of wakefulness, recorded at a frequency of up to 6.5 Hz, however with the presence of typical physiological graphoelements of sleep. b recording of epileptiform paroxysms of the spike and sharp wave type, with generalized projection, with anterior accentuation, occurring in rhythmic bursts of short duration of 3 to 4 seconds. the paroxysms are followed by delta waves and, occasionally, rhythmic activity in the beta range of short duration of less than 1 second, which also occurred preceding the bursts of paroxysms, as well as in an isolated episode during drowsiness. c outbreaks of generalized delta activity, with bifrontal accentuation, the same projections as the paroxysms, also occurring exclusively during sleep. note: [person] presented stereotyped cephalic lateralization and oromandibular movements during wakefulness, however, without electrographic correlation with ictal patterns. conclusion and electroclinical correlation: the electroencephalogram was abnormal. the findings are compatible with diffuse encephalopathy and generalized epilepsy. computed tomography of the skull 11/12: no relevant alterations; computed tomography of the chest 11/12: no signs of an infectious process; cerebrospinal fluid 13/12: 1 cell; 0 red blood cells; glucose: 96; protein: non-reactive; chloride: 125; lactate: 1.91; transthoracic echocardiography 23/12: no signs of vegetation. no other alterations. cultures: tracheal aspirate: 12/27: enterobacter cloacae complex sensitive to meropenem 12/19: negative 12/12: staphylococcus aureus oxas resistant to clindamycin 01/07: staphylococcus epidermididis oxar blood culture: 12/27: negative so far 12/19: staphylococcus hominis 12/13: negative 01/07: 01/16: pseudomonas aeroginosas sensitive to ciprofloxacin, cephalosporin and aminoglycoside urine culture: 12/27: negative 01/07: negative venous catheter: 12/27: negative 12/19: corynebacterium sensitive to vancomycin and teicoplanin 01/09: staphylococcus epidermidis oxar cerebrospinal fluid: 12/13: micrococcus sp antibiotic therapy: current: ceftazidime d0 01/19 pseudomonas bloodstream infection. AEDC follow-up appointments: 02/02 schedule to complete antibiotic therapy directed at pseudomonas bloodstream infection: using ceftazidime d3, maintain for 7-10 days: currently clinically stable, cpr falling, last 2.5 AEDC: 02/02/22 maintain current antiepileptic drugs until follow-up appointment: phenytoin 100 mg 12/12h phenobarbital 100 mg 12/12h topiramate 100 100 200 clobazam 20 mg 8/8h lamotrigine 100 100 200 I renew prescriptions from [organization] regarding deep vein thrombosis: I prescribe rivaroxaban 20 mg/d, I provide a prescription for 6 months. I request follow-up in the network. Follow-up by physiotherapy at the CER: difficulty walking, associated with equine feet. Wheelchair, bath and diaper report: already delivered. Treatment for scabies with ivermectin was carried out on 01/17, repeat in 7 days. Regular general condition, acyanotic, anicteric, hydrated, afebrile. Cardiac auscultation: regular heart rhythm in 2t, normal sound sounds, no audible murmurs. Respiratory auscultation: vesicular breath sounds in both hemithorax, no adventitious sounds. Globular abdomen, bowel sounds, depressed and no signs of defense. Warm extremities, capillary refill time less than 3s, free calves Glasgow 14, isochoric and photoreactive pupils, no pupillary hippus, no stigmata of crisis. Can raise all 4 limbs and hold them against gravity. Understands and obeys commands. Equine feet bilaterally.
question: के तपाईंसँग आफ्नो भाइको संस्कृतिको बारेमा कुनै जानकारी छ?
answer: १९/१२ देखि यो रक्त परीक्षणहरूमा देखाइएको छ कि स्ट्याफिलोकोकस ओरियसले गर्दा हुन्छ। १६/०१ देखि यो रक्त परीक्षणहरूमा देखाइएको छ कि स्यूडोमोनस एरुगिनोसाले गर्दा हुन्छ।

discharge_summary: admission: 02/06/2020, discharge: 12/06/2020, stay: 09 d 10 h, location: ward, payer: sus. discharge report [person], 31 years old, born and raised in [address], married, {omitted} at [organization]. date of admission to emergency unit 02/06, hospitalization summary: patient with no known comorbidities or addictions, with severe dry cough, pain in the left hemithorax and decline in general condition that started on 05/20, progressively worsening. sought medical help at the emergency care unit on 01/05 and 02/05 and was released with symptoms. due to persistent complaints, sought consultation with [person], when desaturation and signs of cor pulmonale were evidenced upon pocus according to information from [person]. The patient was referred to our service in poor general condition, hypotensive, with respiratory failure and using a 15 l/min non-rebreathing mask. Orotracheal intubation and intensive care were performed. Pulmonary thromboembolism was ruled out and bilateral pulmonary opacities suggestive of an infectious process were identified. Ceftriaxone, clindamycin, and clarithromycin were started on 6/3 and transitioned to piperacillin, tazobactam, and vancomycin on 6/5 due to septic shock, maintained until 6/12. Vasoactive drugs and neuromuscular blockade were maintained until 6/4. Sedation was discontinued on 6/7, when he was extubated without complications. The patient showed significant clinical, laboratory, and radiological improvements. He was discharged from hospital on 6/12, with guidance on warning signs and symptoms, prescription of symptomatic medications, and referral for follow-up at a primary health care unit. cultures: 04/06 negative urine culture 05/06/23 negative blood culture ongoing antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 03/06 to 05/06 clindamycin 03/06 to 05/06 clarithromycin 03/06 to 05/06 piperacillin tazobactam 05/06 to 12/06 vancomycin 05/06 to 12/06 previous devices: orotracheal tube 03 to 07/06 central venous catheter left internal jugular vein 03 to 11/06 intensive care unit: vasoactive drug 03 to 04/06 orotracheal intubation 03 to 07/06 neuromuscular blocker 03 to 04/06 sedation 03 to 07/06 personal history: denies known comorbidities denies known allergies habits: social drinker denies smoking denies drug use of illicit drugs medications in continuous use: ø. complementary exams: chest tomography 03/06 without images of pulmonary artery filling failure. bilateral consolidative opacities with air bronchograms and angiograms between pleural cavities: without effusions or thickening. warning signs and symptoms: intense pain high fever shortness of breath, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, fatigue intense cough with phlegm guidelines after discharge: follow-up in [organization], where to consider a new chest tomography for follow-up vaccination update symptomatic medications if necessary.
question: के मलाई अस्पताल लैजानु पर्छ?
answer: तपाईंलाई "ज्वरोको नाडी, चिसो पसिना, र सामान्य थकान" थियो। तपाईंको "खराब अवस्था, कम रक्त गणना, र कुनै श्वासप्रश्वास प्रयास थिएन।"

He was discharged from hospital on 6/12, with guidance on warning signs and symptoms, prescription of symptomatic medications, and referral for follow-up at a primary health care unit. cultures: 04/06 negative urine culture 05/06/23 negative blood culture ongoing antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 03/06 to 05/06 clindamycin 03/06 to 05/06 clarithromycin 03/06 to 05/06 piperacillin tazobactam 05/06 to 12/06 vancomycin 05/06 to 12/06 previous devices: orotracheal tube 03 to 07/06 central venous catheter left internal jugular vein 03 to 11/06 intensive care unit: vasoactive drug 03 to 04/06 orotracheal intubation 03 to 07/06 neuromuscular blocker 03 to 04/06 sedation 03 to 07/06 personal history: denies known comorbidities denies known allergies habits: social drinker denies smoking denies drug use of illicit drugs medications in continuous use: ø. complementary exams: chest tomography 03/06 without images of pulmonary artery filling failure. bilateral consolidative opacities with air bronchograms and angiograms between pleural cavities: without effusions or thickening. warning signs and symptoms: intense pain high fever shortness of breath, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, fatigue intense cough with phlegm guidelines after discharge: follow-up in [organization], where to consider a new chest tomography for follow-up vaccination update symptomatic medications if necessary.
question: के मेरो अर्को योजना पनि राम्रो छ?
answer: तपाईं आफ्नो प्राथमिक हेरचाह प्रदायक र नयाँ कलेजो टोमोग्राफीका लागि फलो-अप संस्थासँग भेटको समय तय गर्न सक्नुहुन्छ।

I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. I prescribe SLOK K 1 tablet every 12 hours. Please, whoever evaluates her at the blood center, checks the need to maintain replacement, advises warning signs and to contact the [organization] team if necessary. I request a purchase order for vorizonazole for secondary prophylaxis as instructed by the [organization] team. I schedule a transesophageal echocardiogram for 11/24. I leave pending tests to monitor eosinophilia and GGT changes, atrial fibrillation that, together with the rash presented after vancomycin on 10/31, raised the diagnostic hypothesis of DRESS syndrome by the dermatologist. Despite this hypothesis, [person] showed complete improvement of the rash and a decrease in the eosinophil count. Therefore, we opted for discharge due to low clinical suspicion at the time. I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. hospitalization summary: [person] admitted on 10/04 on d11 of i mcbad d5 of [person] from [organization]. attended a consultation for clinical and laboratory evaluation after hospitalization 09/21 - 10/01. While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward and, from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis. Contacted [organization] and started on micafungin 100 mg 1x/day, as well as fungemia protocol, removal of central access and PIA devices, implantation of peripherally inserted central catheter and collection of catheter tip. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. The hypothesis of Dress syndrome was raised, but [person] showed improvement on 11/4 with improvement in eosinophilia. discharged on 11/04/21, hemodynamically stable, eupneic, afebrile since 10/15, after finishing intravenous vancomycin with a schedule to follow-up appointment daily for infusion of micafungin 100 mg/day at the hospital on the scheduled end date of 11/21, as well as a scheduled follow-up appointment at [organization] for 11/08 to re-discuss the therapeutic schedule and arrange for the next lines of daratunumab chemotherapy.
question: म केही कारणले अस्पताल जानुपर्‍यो।
answer: कारण ब्याक्टेरिया र फङ्गल एन्डोकार्डाइटिस (मुटुको संक्रमण) हो। तपाईंलाई 'केमोथेरापी पछि पाइलोनेफ्राइटिस (मूत्रमार्ग संक्रमण)' को लागि उपचार भइरहेको छ।

question: हाम्रो आमाको परम्परामा कुनै रोग भेटिएको छ?
answer: 'स्टाफिलोकोकस ओरियस' (एक ब्याक्टेरिया) 'समय १०/०४' मा पत्ता लाग्यो। 'क्यान्डिडा ट्रोपिकलिस' (एक फङ्गस) 'समय १०/०८' मा पत्ता लाग्यो।

question: अक्टोबर १९ मा गरिएको कार्ल मार्क्स विस्तार (इकोकार्डियोग्राम) को नतिजा के थियो?
answer: On October 19, mitral valve prolapse was observed increasing in echocardiography in transesophageal echocardiography, which indicates infection (filament imaging), increasing the likelihood of a diagnosis of endocarditis caused by bacteria and fungi.

Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. question: म उपचारका लागि अस्पतालमा गइरहनुपर्छ।
answer: म्याकफ्याडेन, जो अन्तिम पटक मे ११, २०२१ मा बिहान ११:२१ मा अस्पतालमा देखिएका थिए, उनलाई दैनिक १०० मिलीग्राम IMG को इन्फ्युजन दिइन्थ्यो, जुन फलो-अपको क्रममा दैनिक छुटेको थियो।

question: वा म नयाँ औषधि लिनेछु?
answer: डाक्टरहरूले सेलिनालाई फेरि पानी लिन सल्लाह दिए, र ६ हप्तापछि, मास्टेनिया ग्रिलाले समाप्त नभएसम्म पानी लिन थाले।

question: के अर्को हृदय परीक्षण आवश्यक छ?
answer: मलाई २४ तारिखमा ट्रान्सफोरल एकोकेरिडममा स्थानान्तरण गरिनेछ। ६ हप्ताको औंलाको उपचार पूरा गरेपछि, म अर्को एकोकेरिडम गर्ने योजनामा छु।

answer: तपाईंको उपचार तालिका र आगामी सत्रहरूको बारेमा जानकारीको लागि, [संगठन] बाट [पुरुषको नाम] ले [मिति] 11/08/2020 को लागि बैठक तय गर्नुभएको छ।

Despite this hypothesis, [person] showed complete improvement of the rash and a decrease in the eosinophil count. Therefore, we opted for discharge due to low clinical suspicion at the time. I performed reassessment tests for the disease on the day of hospital discharge. hospitalization summary: [person] admitted on 10/04 on d11 of i mcbad d5 of [person] from [organization]. attended a consultation for clinical and laboratory evaluation after hospitalization 09/21 - 10/01. While waiting to be called for a consultation, she developed tremors and an increase in body temperature (pre-consultation temperature 35.6 during tremors 37.3). Due to neutropneic, she was admitted for treatment of febrile neutropenia with immediate initiation of cefepime. She was hospitalized from 09/21 to 10/01 due to dyspnea, when an extensive right lung lesion was identified, with extrinsic compression of the superior vena cava and right atrium. On September 24, the MCBAD regimen was initiated, but during the night of that date, he developed acute pulmonary edema (fluid overload), which resolved after noninvasive ventilation and furosemide. He remained in the intensive care unit for 3 days. He was discharged to the ward, and from there, to [address]. He underwent a control tomography on September 29, which showed complete resolution of compression and reduction of lung injury. After one day of hospitalization, on 10/05, she presented septic shock with need for vasoactive drugs and decreased level of consciousness, being referred to [organization], where she was hospitalized until 10/12. On 10/10, cultures with growth of yeast-like fungi were seen in blood culture 1 sample after 7:00 p.m. Candida tropicalis. Contacted [organization] and started on micafungin 100 mg 1x/day, as well as fungemia protocol, removal of central access and PIA devices, implantation of peripherally inserted central catheter and collection of catheter tip. In addition to abdominal and fundus ultrasound. The transthoracic echocardiogram showed no evidence of vegetations on examination. Therefore, transthoracic echocardiography was performed on 10/19 with the presence of filamentous images in the mitral valve suggestive of infectious vegetation, associated with mild mitral insufficiency, confirming the diagnostic hypothesis of bacterial and fungal endocarditis. Discussed with [person] from [organization] on 10/18, who advised to maintain micafungin because most Candida tropicalis are sensitive. Chest tomography was repeated on 10/18, showing control of multiple myeloma with extensive bone and right pleural disease, with disease stability in relation to 09/29 and pulmonary opacities including nodules, with the main suspicion of infectious alteration being septic embolism or fungal disease. In discussion with the [organization] team and rediscussed with [organization], we were advised to maintain antibiotics for 4 weeks from the start of treatment and not from the culture on 10/05/21 and antifungal for 6 weeks from 10/10/21. After the 6 weeks, repeat the echocardiogram and continue oral voriconazole for an indefinite period of time. Candida tropicalis is resistant to fluco and intermediate to voriconazole, given that there is no surgical plan for removal of vegetation of possible fungal etiology. On 10/31, the patient presented a skin rash with no hemodynamic repercussions and no warning signs. The hypothesis of Dress syndrome was raised, but [person] showed improvement on 11/4 with improvement in eosinophilia. discharged on 11/04/21, hemodynamically stable, eupneic, afebrile since 10/15, after finishing intravenous vancomycin with a schedule to follow-up appointment daily for infusion of micafungin 100 mg/day at the hospital on the scheduled end date of 11/21, as well as a scheduled follow-up appointment at [organization] for 11/08 to re-discuss the therapeutic schedule and arrange for the next lines of daratunumab chemotherapy.
question: अक्टोबर ३१ आइपुग्यो, र म धेरै खुसी छु।
answer: अक्टोबर ३१ मा, हामीले तपाईंको शरीरमा एउटा रातो दाग मात्र पायौं। यसलाई 'ड्रेस सिन्ड्रोम' मानिएको थियो, तर रातो दाग पूर्ण रूपमा गायब भयो, र इओसिनोफिल गणना घट्यो। त्यसकारण, क्लिनिकल शंका कम भएकोले, हामीले तपाईंलाई मौका दिने निर्णय गर्‍यौं।

question: मेरो मल्टिपल मायलोमा कस्तो बढिरहेको छ? पछिल्लो सीटी स्क्यानले के देखायो?
answer: अक्टोबर १८ मा, टोमोग्राफीले अस्थि मज्जा र फोक्सोको पेरेन्काइमाको "मल्टिपल माइलोमा संलग्नता" र "कर्ड संलग्नता" देखायो।

question: ए, मेरो क्रिएटिनिनको स्तर असामान्य छ? के डायलाइसिसको आवश्यकता छ?
answer: तपाईंलाई 'क्रोनिक किड्नी डिजिज CKD-3' (जुन दोस्रो पटकपछि सेप्सिस मानिन्छ) भएको पत्ता लाग्यो। तपाईं ११ देखि १३ सम्म 'किड्नी रिप्लेसमेन्ट ट्रिटमेन्ट' (डायलिसिस) गराइरहनुभएको थियो।

question: तपाईँ कति सुत्नुहुन्छ, अनि कति लामो समयसम्म जागो रहनुहुन्छ?

question: परिणाम के थियो?
answer: त्यस पुरुषले आफ्नो खुट्टा गुमाए, मृगौला र अन्य अङ्गहरू बिग्रिए र अन्ततः उनको मृत्यु भयो।

discharge_summary: admission: 09/01/2020, discharge: 09/17/2020, stay: 16 d 13 h, location: ward, payer: SUS. A 67-year-old patient with a history of overweight, smoking, and major depression was admitted on 09/01 with a perforative acute abdomen, diagnosed after examinations. On the evening of 08/31, she sought care with abdominal pain, general malaise, and dyspnea. She had undergone hysterectomy on 08/30. On 09/01, she underwent exploratory laparotomy with a finding of intestinal perforation, with a suture of the lesion and placement of a peritoneostomy. She developed severe circulatory shock, probably due to peritonitis from contamination of the abdominal cavity, and antibiotic treatment was promptly started. She was re-addressed on 09/06, where an appendectomy and abdominal wall closure were performed. On 09/07, the patient's ventilatory status began to worsen, and a chest tomography scan was performed on 09/08, revealing low-load pulmonary embolism (5%) in addition to pneumonia. A multiresistant germ was isolated in a lung culture, with specific treatment directed at the patient. Given the clinical progression, a tracheostomy was indicated due to the need for prolonged mechanical ventilation. On 09/15, {omitted} prolonged cardiopulmonary arrest was reversed after approximately 20 minutes. The patient follow-up appointmented to the intensive care unit after the procedure, with mydriatic pupils and absence of reflexes. On 09/17, a computed tomography scan of the skull was performed, revealing anoxic-ischemic encephalopathy. Tests were performed to confirm brain death, which was confirmed on {omitted}. Perforating acute abdomen. 09/01: computed tomography of the abdomen and pelvis: pneumoperitoneum, ascites, signs of peritonitis, parietal hyperalces and edema of the loops 09/01: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary congestion, cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusion, opacities suggestive of an inflammatory or infectious process 09/08: computed tomography of the chest, pulmonary thromboembolism with 5% embolic burden 09/17: computed tomography of the skull. 09/01: exploratory laparotomy, sigmoid suture, creation of peritoneostomy 09/06: review, touch-ups on previous surgery with appendectomy and closure of the abdominal wall 09/15: tracheostomy 09/15: bilateral chest drainage. death.
question: के म अस्पताल जाँदैछु?
answer: उनी ३१ अगस्ट २०१९ मा श्वासप्रश्वासको समस्या, ज्वरो र सास फेर्न गाह्रो भएको कारण अस्पताल भर्ना भएका थिए र १ सेप्टेम्बर २०१९ मा सङ्क्रमणका कारण उनको मृत्यु भयो।

question: केटिन, के मेरो शल्यक्रिया २०१०/१ को लागि तय गरिएको छ?
answer: तपाईंको खोजले मिल्दो नतिजा दियो, र डाक्टरहरूले आन्द्रामा प्वाल भेट्टाए। उहाँले पर्फोरेटिङ शल्यक्रिया र पेरिटोनियोस्टोमी गर्नुभयो।

question: शल्यक्रियापछि म केही समयका लागि कोमामा थिएँ।
answer: Emphyema  Emphyema means ‘swelling of the back of the muscle’ usually caused by major surgery.

question: ०९/०६/२०२० के मैले अर्को रगत परीक्षण गर्नुपर्ने हुन्छ?

question: के हाम्रो आन्द्रामा कुनै प्रकारको समस्या छ?
answer: उनले ९ जुलाई २०१० मा भने कि "रोगको पूर्वानुमान धेरै राम्रो देखिन्छ"। ९ अगस्त २०१० मा गरिएको सिटी स्क्यानले "प्लेभोलेक्सको साथ एक सौम्य पल्मोनरी एम्बोलिज्म" देखायो।

question: के फसल सेप्टेम्बर १५ देखि मात्र आउँदैछ?
answer: नोभेम्बर १५ मा, तपाईँले लामो समयसम्म रहने चुम्बन प्राप्त गर्नुभयो र त्यसपछि तपाईँलाई पुनर्जीवित गर्नुपर्‍यो (उनलाई हृदयाघात भयो)।

question: के तपाईँलाई अस्पताल जानु पर्नेछ जस्तो लाग्छ?
answer: आधिकारिक प्रतिवेदनमा, यो निष्कर्ष निकालियो कि "केही गलत खेल" भएको थियो "पोस्टमार्टम रिपोर्टले यसलाई पुष्टि गर्दछ"।

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: के म अस्पताल जाँदैछु?
answer: तपाईंलाई 'आँखाको बारेमा कोरोनाभाइरस जटिलताहरू' थिए। तपाईंलाई 'आँखाको बारेमा कोरोनाभाइरस जटिलताहरू' थिए, र 'कोठामा अक्सिजनको स्तर ८८% थियो, बिस्तारै घट्दै गइरहेको थियो'।

question: के मैले ट्रेकियोस्टोमी गर्नुपर्छ?
answer: उहाँ 'फाइब्रोस्कोप' मा हुनुहुन्थ्यो र लक्षणविहीन हुनुहुन्थ्यो। ३ मार्च २०१० मा, उहाँको डेकानुलाइजेसन (ट्यूब हटाउने) भयो। डिस्चार्ज पछि, उहाँ 'ट्रेकियोस्टोमी' मा ड्रेनेजको साथ हुनुहुन्थ्यो।

answer: तपाईं 'राम्रो, सामान्य' अवस्थामा हुनुहुन्छ। तपाईंको नाडी सामान्य छ, अक्सिजन संतृप्ति ९४% मा सामान्य छ। ग्लासगो १५, बार। तपाईं हात र खुट्टामा चौथो-डिग्री गतिशीलताको साथ सुरक्षित रूपमा हिँड्न सक्नुहुन्छ, तर स्वतन्त्र रूपमा होइन।

discharge_summary: 1 severe acute respiratory syndrome, due to coronavirus. 2 new septic shock 01/14, fever hypotension, 3 acneiform eruption secondary to corticosteroid therapy, 4 pneumomediastinum airway injury? subcutaneous emphysema after depronation worsening ventilatory status, 5 new septic shock on 01/24 start of vasoactive drug, leukocytosis, 6 reactive adrenal insufficiency? hyperkalemia hyponatremia shock. admission: 01/06/2020, discharge: 03/03/2020, stay: 01 m 24 d 18 h, location: ward, payer: sus. clinical history [person] reports that he started with headache, myalgia and dry cough on 12/28, persisting with the same until 12/31, when he sought care and was prescribed prednisone, azithromycin, zinc and symptomatics. [person] started taking prescribed medications and on 02/01 he started with a fever, having performed a PCR for coronavirus with no result yet. On 03/01 he presented respiratory discomfort, having sought care on 04/01, when antibiotic therapy was changed to intravenous; the family member does not know which medication, however, there was no indication for hospital admission. [person] persisted with respiratory discomfort, having been hospitalized in the early hours of the same day. Emergency care unit report of oxygen saturation of 88% on room air, progressively worsening. He was admitted to the emergency unit on 06/01 with severe pulmonary involvement on chest x-ray, and was continued on antibiotic therapy initiated in the emergency care unit, ceftriaxone daily on 05/01 and prophylactic dexamethasone and enoxaparin initiated. He was admitted to [organization] on 07/01, requiring orotracheal intubation and central venous catheterization. He presented septic shock on 14/01, and his antibiotic regimen was changed. He remained in bed at [organization]. He developed new septic shock on 24/01, and began using fluconazole for fungal coverage. He developed pneumomediastinum on 26/01 due to airway injury, and underwent conservative treatment. He underwent tracheostomy on 29/01. He presented reactive adrenal insufficiency and acneiform rash related to corticosteroid therapy, in addition to diarrhea treated empirically with the hypothesis of pseudomembranous colitis. Acinetobacter baumanii was isolated in the tracheal aspirate, but was not treated due to the lack of clinical repercussion. He presented progressive clinical improvement and was transferred to [organization], where he remained stable. He underwent fibroscopy and was evaluated by speech therapy on 02/03, with no residual airway injury identified and a soft diet was released. He was decannulated on 03/03, remaining eupneic and in condition to be discharged. Good general condition, alert, acyanotic, anicteric, afebrile, Glasgow 15, oxygen saturation 94% in room air with capped tracheostomy, respiratory rate 28 inspirations per minute, muscle strength grade 4 in upper and lower limbs, regular heart rhythm in two beats, normal sound sounds without murmurs. Heart rate 76, vesicular breath sounds present, symmetrical, without adventitious sounds, without use of accessory muscles. Flaccid, flat abdomen, painless to palpation, without masses or visceromegaly. Extremities: palpable peripheral pulses, without edema, absence of swelling of the calves. Presence of pressure ulcer in the left lower limb, without signs of infection. Tracheostomy fibroscopy. I advise [person] on outpatient follow-up visits for: head and neck surgery on 03/15 speech therapy on 03/25 reassessment of diet physiatry to be scheduled I advise [person] on home care for tracheostomy orifice, diet, exercise and care. I prescribe symptomatic medications. Aminc, head and neck surgery, speech therapy, physiatry. Good general condition, slim, conscious and oriented, moving all 4 limbs actively with grade 4 muscle strength, still not able to walk alone. Tracheostomy orifice occluded with dressing and eating a soft diet. No pain complaints.
question: के तपाईँ भेट्न चाहनुहुन्छ वा जारी राख्न चाहनुहुन्छ?
answer: तपाईंले आफ्नो भाइको उपचारको लागि जानुपर्नेछ: ०३/१५ को मौसम क्षति र ०३/२५ को कुराकानी उपचारको लागि केवल शल्यक्रिया... तपाईंले फिजियोथेरापीको लागि समय तालिका बनाउनुपर्नेछ।

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: के मलाई अस्पताल लैजानु पर्छ?
answer: तपाईंलाई 'इमरजेन्सी केयर युनिट' मा पठाइएको थियो। तपाईं ३ दिन अघि 'अचानक ढले' र तपाईंलाई धेरै ज्वरो र दुखाइ थियो। तपाईंलाई उच्च ज्वरो (३८.३ डिग्री सेल्सियस) र सुख्खा खोकी थियो।

question: के मलाई सास फेर्न गाह्रो भइरहेको छ?
answer: उद्धारको क्रममा, उनी एउटा जलाशयमा मास्क लगाएको र १० लिटर प्रति मिनेटको दरले सास फेरिरहेको अवस्थामा भेटिए। उनको परीक्षणले 'सुक्खा फोक्सो र कम श्वास दर' देखाएको छ। छोटो रिपोर्टमा उनलाई 'निमोनिया' भएको उल्लेख छ।

answer: मे २९ मा, जब तपाईँको कोभिड-१९ परीक्षणको नतिजा सकारात्मक आयो, तपाईँलाई 'एयरवे इन्ट्युबेशन एन्ड मेकानिकल भेन्टिलेसन' अस्पतालमा भर्ना गरियो र 'सास फेर्न गाह्रो' भयो।

question: मलाई खोकी लाग्यो। यसलाई 'एक्सहेलेसन' भनिन्थ्यो।
answer: ०६ अप्रिल २०१० मा, बिरामीको जाँच गरेपछि, उसको रिपोर्टमा "न्युमोथोरेक्स र एम्पीमा दुवै व्यापक थिए" भनिएको थियो। यसको मतलब दुवै फोक्सो भाँचिएको थियो, र छातीमा हावा जम्मा भएको थियो।

question: के तपाईँले मेरो टेप सम्पादन गर्न आवश्यक छ?
answer: भित्र 'खोर निमोथ्रेक्स' (खोर निमबन्डे कुडाके) थियो। साथै 'खोर उँचा नाली' (खोर नाली) थपिएको थियो। २०७३/२०७४ मा 'येता नाली' हटाइयो। खोर नाली यथावत् रह्यो।

question: हाम्रो अन्नको आपूर्ति किन कम हुँदै गएको छ?
answer: तपाईंको मिर्गौलाले जुन १८ मा काम गर्न छोड्यो (चरण III)। जुन २० मा फेरि सुधार भएको छ र तपाईंलाई हेमोडायलिसिस चाहिन्छ।

discharge_summary: 1. coronavirus infection onset of symptoms 02/17 orotracheal intubation 02/24 extubation 03/08 2. septic shock from pulmonary focus requiring vasoactive drug resolved: antibiotic therapy: ceftriaxone 02/23 03/02 clarithromycin 04/24 03/02 corticosteroid therapy: 02/24 03/09 3. critically ill polyneuropathy grade 2 strength upper limbs and lower limbs 4. pressure injury left lower limb grade i 5. your appointment scheduled with gynecology. on 03/24 for investigation. admission: 02/24/2020, discharge: 03/19/2020, stay: 22 d 21 h, location: ward, payer: sus. current: [person] with severe acute respiratory syndrome due to coronavirus, onset of symptoms on 02/17, requiring orotracheal intubation due to respiratory failure on 02/24, due to the possibility of associated bacterial pneumonia, antibiotic therapy with ceftriaxone and clarithromycin was performed. question: हाम्रो 'असामान्य रगत' हराउनुको कारण के हो?
answer: विशेष गरी, "[गर्भाशय] प्रवेश गर्दा असामान्य रूपमा फैलिएको थियो। तपाईंलाई स्त्रीरोग सम्बन्धी समस्याको लागि भर्ना गरिएको थियो... [परीक्षण] मार्च २४, २०२१ को लागि तय गरिएको थियो," र "गर्भाशयको गर्भावस्था जाँच २२ मार्च, २०२१ को पेल्भी अल्ट्रासाउन्डद्वारा गरिनेछ।"

question: मेरो दाहिने हात कति घाइते भएको छ?
answer: तपाईंको तल्लो बायाँ भागमा 'आन्तरिक पेटको चाप' ग्रेड १ छ, जुन तल्लो दाहिने भागमा 'पेटको कम्मर, ग्रेड १' हो। तपाईंको पहिलो हेरचाह प्रदायकले तपाईंलाई पहिलो हेरचाह एकाइमा तल्लो दाहिने भागमा 'पेटको कम्मर ड्रेसरहरू' दिनुभएको छ।

question: के पुरुषमा पेट दुख्नबाट रोक्नका लागि उपायहरू अपनाउन आवश्यक छ?

question: के म अस्पताल गएँ?
answer: उनी 'शोक' मा थिए, 'पक्षाघात', 'भ्रम' र 'स्ट्रोक' बाट पीडित थिए। यातायात टोलीले उनलाई उद्धार गर्‍यो किनभने उनको रक्तचाप ग्लासगो ६ बाट ६०x०० mmHg थियो, र उनका हात र खुट्टाहरू सुन्न थिए।

question: सेप्टिक शक किन हुन्छ?
answer: उहाँलाई "सेप्टिक शक एब्डोमिनल फोकस" र "सेप्टिक शक हेमाटोसिस" पत्ता लाग्यो। उहाँका लक्षणहरूमा "सामान्य कमजोरी, पखाला, र घटेको क्रिश्चियन" र "हेमोडाइनामिक अस्थिरता" (रातो धर्काहरू आउनु) समावेश थिए, त्यसैले उहाँले "नोराड्रेनालाईन" (रातो रङ्ग बढाउने औषधि) लिनुपर्‍यो।

question: के मेरो भाइ बिरामी छ?
answer: उनलाई 'क्लबबिल निमोनिया' र 'कल्चर ०३/२२' को सही निदान गरिएको थियो। यसले 'सेप्टिक शक हेमरेज' र 'हेमोडायनामिक अस्थिरता' निम्त्यायो।

answer: Transesophageal echocardiogram (TCE) reveals a "significantly reduced systolic echocardiogram heart area", "partial segmental Doppler velocities" and "mild mitral valve insufficiency".

question: ए, तिम्रो कानमा केही छ, दाजु?
answer: तपाईंले 'असामान्य मुटुको धड्कन' अध्ययनमा भाग लिनुभयो। 'इलेक्ट्रोकार्डियोग्राम प्रविष्टि ०३/१५' ले कुनै 'एट्रियल फाइब्रिलेसन' पत्ता लगाउन सकेन, जुन तपाईंको परिवारका सदस्यहरूले पत्ता लगाए र 'पहिलेदेखिको अवस्था' भएको पुष्टि गरे।

question: परिणाम के थियो?
answer: एक जना डाक्टरलाई बोलाइयो, र उनले बिरामीको 'पल्स रेट' पत्ता लगाए: ० बीट्स प्रति मिनेट, मनिटरमा कुनै विद्युतीय गतिविधि पत्ता लागेन। शारीरिक परीक्षणले 'कुनै केन्द्रीय अवरोध' देखाएन... कुनै परावर्तक पृष्ठ, कुनै परावर्तक कोर्निया, र आँखाको नतिजा सकारात्मक थियो।

discharge_summary: 1. pneumonia, pulmonary metastasis? negative external rt pcr on 06/21 verified by surveillance on 06/23 2. syncope to be clarified neurocardiogenic? investigation suspended 3. consumptive syndrome due to duodenal papilla neoplasia. admission: 06/23/2020, discharge: 06/30/2020, stay: 07 d 05 h, location: ward, payer: sus. history of current illness admission: [person] referred from the emergency care unit, where he was hospitalized for 4 days. reports that 3 days ago he had a sudden episode of loss of consciousness, not preceded by prodromes, with follow-up appointment after a few seconds. level of consciousness without dysfunctions afterwards, without release of sphincters. reports only significant asthenia and fatigue associated. had 2 of these episodes on this day. had already had another similar syncope 20 days ago. He had several episodes of vomiting, which started 5 days ago and improved 2 days ago. His family called [organization] due to his condition. During the evaluation by the transport team, [person] reported an episode of fever (38.3 °C) and dry cough since 06/10. During hospitalization at [organization], he was given antibiotic therapy and referred [person] to our services. His syncope did not recur. He reported diarrhea for 15 days and improvement for 3 days, which is why his chemotherapy cycle was suspended. Upon admission, [person] was hemodynamically stable, breathing with a mask with a reservoir at 10 L/min, without respiratory distress, and denying any complaints at the moment. He is afebrile. Edema of the lower limbs, crackles, and reduced vesicular breath sounds on the left. [person] was pale and emaciated. No relevant results. Pleural fluid puncture and chest drain. Pneumonia, no pending tests. Antibiotic therapy: cefepime and clarithromycin. [person] evolves into death.
question: के म अस्पताल जाँदैछु?
answer: उनलाई "प्याराप्लेजिया, डिजिटल डिस्प्निया, कर्कश आवाज", "हाइपोक्सिमिया", "पुरपुरा" र "हाइपोटेन्सन" भएको पत्ता लागेको थियो।

discharge_summary: admission: 23/02/2020, discharge: 09/03/2020, stay: 14 d, location: ward, payer: sus. [person], 65 years old, born and raised in [address], widower. problem: asthenia, worsening of basal dyspnea, drowsiness, desaturation, bladder indwelling urinary catheter with pyuria, hypotension and worsening of perfusion diagnostic hypotheses: 1. mixed shock: septic of urinary focus, weaning from norepinephrine on 25/02, cardiogenic, heart failure, due to decompensated alcoholic cardiomyopathy profile, weaning from dobutamine on 03/03 started tridil 26/02 and oral vasodilators on 27/02/2020. 2. acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creatinine: 6.57 urea: 348: acute ischemic tubular necrosis secondary to infection, SCR type 1 on renal replacement therapy since 02/23/2020. cultures: blood culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae in 2 samples at 22 and 42 h. urine culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae. history: systemic arterial hypertension, hypothyroidism? chronic liver disease, active significant alcoholism, active smoking 110 pack-years, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, presumed pulmonology evaluation on 08/18. Evolution: despite the culture showing Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, [person] showed a good clinical response to meropenem, thus concluding the use of meropenem 1000 mg 1x/day 500 mg post renal replacement therapy for 14 days dated 02/23/2020. He evolved with improvement in infectious parameters, afebrile, with no genitourinary or cardiorespiratory complaints. Latest laboratory tests: Hb: 12.4 ht: 37 platelets: 123 gb: 7.5 without deviation to the left. Undergoing follow-up with nephrology, daily hemodialysis was performed. Schedule: with completion of antibiotic therapy and maintenance of improvement in clinical parameters, discharged from [organization] on 03/09/2020. Scheduled by nephrology for follow-up on acute dialysis on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, in the first shift.
question: के म बिरामी छु?
answer: २३/०२/२०२० र २३/०२/२०२० को स्तरमा मातृ र पितृ दुवै मृत्युदरलाई 'कार्ब्युनेकेटम-प्रतिरोधी निमोनिया' (एक ब्याक्टेरिया) को रूपमा परिभाषित गरिएको थियो।

question: मिक्स टस के हो? यसको उद्देश्य के हो?
answer: ब्याक-इन्ड रिपोर्टले 'सानो चोट' पनि भन्छ। यसले 'म्युकोर्मिकोसिस सङ्क्रमण', 'रक्सी पिउनाले हुने मुटुको धड्कन, कार्डियोमायोप्याथी (तपाईंको मुटु)' पनि भन्छ।

question: मेरो क्रिएटिनिन असामान्य छ, के मैले डायलाइसिस गर्नुपर्दैन र?
answer: तपाईंको गुरुद्वारा गम्भीर खतम ३' (क्रिएटिनिन: ६.५७) थियो, जुन 'सङ्क्रमण' को कारणले भएको थियो। तपाईंको गुरुद्वारा प्रत्यारोपण (डायलिसिस) २/२३/२०२० को लागि निर्धारित गरिएको थियो।

question: मेरो रिपोर्टले मलाई 'प्रतिरोधी' सङ्क्रमण भएको बताउँछ। मलाई एन्टिबायोटिकको विचारले नै डर लाग्छ। (मोर्फिन)
answer: Sarswati states, "While Sanskrit has been defined as 'the sum total of values held by a group of people', in this context it is defined as 'the conduct of a sage'".

answer: तपाईँले कुनै पनि बान्ता वा पेट दुख्ने समस्या बिना एन्टिबायोटिक कोर्स पुरा गर्न सक्नुभयो।

[person], 65 years old, born and raised in [address], widower. problem: asthenia, worsening of basal dyspnea, drowsiness, desaturation, bladder indwelling urinary catheter with pyuria, hypotension and worsening of perfusion diagnostic hypotheses: 1. mixed shock: septic of urinary focus, weaning from norepinephrine on 25/02, cardiogenic, heart failure, due to decompensated alcoholic cardiomyopathy profile, weaning from dobutamine on 03/03 started tridil 26/02 and oral vasodilators on 27/02/2020. 2. acute kidney injury kdigo 3 creatinine: 6.57 urea: 348: acute ischemic tubular necrosis secondary to infection, SCR type 1 on renal replacement therapy since 02/23/2020. cultures: blood culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae in 2 samples at 22 and 42 h. urine culture 02/23/2020: carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae. history: systemic arterial hypertension, hypothyroidism? chronic liver disease, active significant alcoholism, active smoking 110 pack-years, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, presumed pulmonology evaluation on 08/18. Evolution: despite the culture showing Klebsiella pneumoniae carbapenemase, [person] showed a good clinical response to meropenem, thus concluding the use of meropenem 1000 mg 1x/day 500 mg post renal replacement therapy for 14 days dated 02/23/2020. He evolved with improvement in infectious parameters, afebrile, with no genitourinary or cardiorespiratory complaints. Latest laboratory tests: Hb: 12.4 ht: 37 platelets: 123 gb: 7.5 without deviation to the left. Undergoing follow-up with nephrology, daily hemodialysis was performed. Schedule: with completion of antibiotic therapy and maintenance of improvement in clinical parameters, discharged from [organization] on 03/09/2020. Scheduled by nephrology for follow-up on acute dialysis on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, in the first shift.
question: मलाई किन हेरिरहेका छौ?
answer: तपाईंलाई बुधबार, बिहीबार र शुक्रबार बिहान नेफ्रोलोजी वार्डमा तीव्र डायलाइसिसको लागि तालिका गरिएको छ।

discharge_summary: id: [person], 49 years old, from [address], born in {city}. admission 17/11/2020 1. severe alcoholic hepatitis with child b7 meld encephalopathy on the 9th abdominal ultrasound 11/17 hepatomegaly and diffuse increased liver echogenicity, suggestive of fatty disease. gallstones. mild splenomegaly. last alcoholic libation in mid-november 2. fever probable urinary focus urine culture 12/30/2020 multisensitive escherichia coli ceftriaxone in: 12/30/2020 complications resolved with hospitalization:. chronic diarrhea associated with alcohol. respiratory failure nosocomial pneumonia 12/07: fever, tachypnea, requiring oxygen chest tomography 12/06/2020: pulmonary opacities with an organizing pneumonia pattern that may correspond to an inflammatory or infectious process, which may present with viral pneumonia, involving 25-30% of the parenchyma. bilateral pleural effusion. severe coronary atheromatosis rapid coronavirus test 12/08/2020 negative coronavirus PCR 12/07/2020: inconclusive, orotracheal intubation for acute respiratory failure on 12/13 extubation on 12/23 performed 7 days of meropenem termination 12/15, personal history: mood disorder? systemic arterial hypertension, obesity, diabetes mellitus? dyslipidemia, epilepsy? question: मलाई किन केही नराम्रो हुनेछ भन्ने अनौठो अनुभूति भइरहेको छ?
answer: तपाईँलाई तीव्र जन्डिस छ। तपाईँलाई तीव्र जन्डिस, हेपाटोमेगाली, वाकवाकी र गम्भीर हेपाटिक कोमाको लक्षणहरू छन्।

question: के तपाईँलाई बत्ती पाउन कुनै समस्या भयो? अनि के तपाईँले बत्ती चलाउनु पर्‍यो?
answer: निमोनियाको कारणले गर्दा सास फेर्न गाह्रो भएपछि तपाईंलाई अस्पतालमा भर्ना गरियो। तपाईंको दोस्रो छातीको रेडियोग्राफले २५-३०% फोक्सो अस्पष्ट देखाएको छ। यो गम्भीर जटिलताको कारणले गर्दा, तपाईंलाई १२/१३ देखि १२/२३ सम्म इन्ट्युबेट (श्वासप्रश्वास नली) गर्नुपर्‍यो।

answer: मे ८, २०२० मा तपाईंको कोरोनाभाइरस परीक्षणको नतिजा नकारात्मक थियो। मे ७, २०२० मा गरिएको दोस्रो कोरोनाभाइरस पीसीआर परीक्षणको नतिजा अनिश्चित थियो।

question: के मैले रोगको उपचार गरें?
answer: तपाईंलाई एस्चेरिचिया कोलाईको कारणले भएको म्युकोट्रमाको लागि सेप्टिरोक्सन एन्टिबायोटिक दिइएको थियो। तपाईंलाई अस्पतालमा निमोनियाको लागि मार्पेनियम एन्टिबायोटिक दिइएको थियो।

question: कस्तो ख्याल राख्नुपर्छ?
answer: तपाईंले रगतमा चिनीको समस्याको लागि घर सेवा र घर मोटर फिजियोथेरापी पाउन सक्नुहुन्छ। तपाईंको १७औँ जाँचको लागि फलो-अप अपोइन्टमेन्ट पनि छ।

question: म औषधि किन्न जानु पर्ला?
answer: तपाईंले अस्पतालमा प्रयोग गर्नुभएको औषधिहरू राख्न आउनुभएको छ। सूचीमा लोसार्टन, सिट्रोपिन, सिम्वास्टाटिन, क्लोनाजेपाम, भ्याल्प्रोइक एसिड, फेनोबार्बिटल, र फेनोफाइब्रेट कम्प्लेक्स समावेश छन्।

question: म अस्पताल गएँ। के म साँच्चै बिरामी परेँ?
answer: The underlying cause is "like-this" eclampsia with decompensation, although aspiration pneumonia or hypoglycemia is also possible.

question: मेरा हात र खुट्टाहरू किन यति कमजोर छन्?
answer: तीव्र स्ट्रोकको एउटा विशिष्ट उदाहरण क्षणिक इस्केमिक आक्रमण हो।

question: तिमीले मलाई कति धेरै सराप्छौ?
answer: तपाईंको रगतमा रोगको इतिहास थियो। रगतको कल्चरबाट, जिब्रोको कार्बिनोसिसलाई हटाउन सीटी स्क्यानबाट विभेदक कल्चरहरू सङ्कलन गरियो।

question: के उसले रगतको समूह फेला पारेको छ?
answer: ओहो, सिटी स्क्यानले देखाउँछ कि तपाईंको मुटु र मस्तिष्कमा जाने २५% धमनीहरूमा थ्रोम्बोसिस भएको छ। तपाईंले निकोपारिन नामक एन्टिकोगुलेन्टको साथ उपचार सुरु गर्नुभएको छ।

question: तपाईँले मस्तिष्क स्क्यानमा के देख्नुभयो?
answer: कम्प्युटेड टोमोग्राफीले खोपडीको अगाडिको, पछाडिको वा पछाडिको कोर्टिकल, सबकोर्टिकल, हाइपोस्टेनोसेसमा कुनै असामान्यता देखाएन।

question: के तपाईँले मलाई मेरो इइजी रिपोर्टबाट रिपोर्ट देखाउनुभयो?
answer: तपाईंको इलेक्ट्रोएन्सेफलोग्राम (EEG) रिडिङ असामान्य थियो। नतिजाले 'गहिरो असामान्य डिसोसिएटिभ कार्य प्रकार्य' देखाउँछ, जुन 'आघातजन्य मस्तिष्क चोट' सँग मिल्दोजुल्दो छ। थप रूपमा, मस्तिष्कको चुम्बकीय अनुनाद इमेजिङ (MRI) स्क्यानले 'घाउहरूको जटिल ढाँचा' देखायो।

answer: तपाईँ ओकामा र टुकीसँग मे ५ मा आउनुभयो। मे १२ मा तपाईँलाई हाइपोक्सिमिया (कम अक्सिजन), हाइपोक्सिया (कम अक्सिजन), र एन्डोटोरासिक ट्युब (ईटीटी) थियो।

question: मेरो इबे स्टेट कस्तो छ?
answer: तपाईंलाई सन् २००० मा ह्युमन इम्युनोडेफिशियन्सी भाइरस भएको पत्ता लागेको थियो। अगस्ट २०२० मा तपाईंको भाइरल लोड (CV) पत्ता लागेन, र तपाईंको CD4 गणना ९०४ थियो।

question: मेरो टाउको दुखेको लागि मैले कति औषधि खानु पर्छ?
answer: तपाईंले नियमित रूपमा लिने औषधिहरू राति २५० मिलिग्राम भ्याल्प्रोइक एसिड र २.५ मिलिग्राम क्लोनाजेपाम हुन्। तपाईंको विगतका रेकर्डहरूले देखाउँछ कि तपाईंले पहिलो पटक २०१७ मा क्लोनाजेपाम लिनुभएको थियो र तपाईंको मोटरसाइकल बीमा...

discharge_summary: admission: 12/06, discharge: 12/21, stay: 14 d 11 h, location: ward, payer: sus. 1. heart failure profile c dobutamine on 12/07 and 12/08, 2. abscess in the left thigh, osteomyelitis in the pubis, fournier's syndrome, drainage on 12/03 with ultrasound and drain placement on 12/15, treatment with ceftriaxone guided by culture of abscess escherichia coli multi s colonized antibiotic therapy after shock, incision in intensive care unit on 12/17 with abundant purulent secretion, {omitted}. 3. septic shock from cutaneous urinary focus on 12/16 polymyxin d0 12/15 amikacin and vancomycin on 12/17, 4. chronic kidney disease acute dialysis by fistula on 12/16 5. cardiorespiratory arrest with pulseless electrical activity, 10 minutes after intubation report of previous bradycardia, follow-up appointment after 1 minute of cardiopulmonary resuscitation, 6. vt with pulse after cardiorespiratory arrest, effective electrical cardioversion with a shock. [person] presenting with instability in the last half hour, requiring norepinephrine elevation up to 1.5 mcg/kg/min. progresses with bradycardia, QRS widening, and worsening shock. Given the hyperkalemia even after hemodialysis, 2 ampoules of calcium gluconate and 100 ml of bicarbonate were administered, and the respiratory rate was increased on the ventilator in order to reduce pco2 and consequently k. 2 ampoules of atropine were administered without benefit. [person] progressed to asystolic cardiorespiratory arrest, {omitted} in refractory shock. I declare {omitted} dead, due to absence of central pulses, pupils in fixed mydriasis, absence of heart sounds and asytole on the monitor, as well as absence of brainstem reflexes. The body was released. I request contact with the family. I await the death certificate to be completed. Death. Drainage of Fournier's gangrene. Death.
question: मेरो पुरुष साथी किन बिरामी छ?
answer: उसको दाहिने हातमा एउटा पुच्छर थियो, र उसलाई एसटिडब्ल्यू र क्रोहन रोग थियो। पुच्छरको कल्चरले एस्चेरिचिया कोलाई पत्ता लगायो। यो सेप्टिक छाला र पिसाब संक्रमण भएको आशंका गरिएको थियो।

question: के यसमा एउटा हुनुपर्दैन, त्यो सङ्केतका लागि मात्र भए पनि?
answer: ओहो, तिमी छक्क पर्यौ, उसलाई सास फेर्न गाह्रो भयो। सुरुमा, नोरएपिनेफ्रिन दिएपछि उसलाई नराम्रो लाग्यो, त्यसपछि उसलाई ब्राडीकार्डिया (मुटुको धड्कन कम हुने) र ठूलो स्ट्रोक भयो। औषधिको प्रयोगपछि, उसलाई इस्केमिक हृदय रोग भयो र सास फेर्न समस्या भएको स्ट्रोक पनि भयो।

question: उनको ज्यान बचाउन कुन शल्य चिकित्सा विधिहरू प्रयोग गरियो?
answer: भोलिपल्ट बिहान, उनलाई नोरेपिनेफ्रिन दिइयो, तर उनको अवस्था झन् खराब भयो र उनलाई क्याल्सियम ग्लुकोनेट, बाइकार्बोनेट अफ सोडा, र एट्रोपिन दिइयो, तर कसैले मद्दत गरेन।

question: तपाईँले सङ्क्रमणको बारेमा के गर्नुभयो?
answer: मान्छेको पेट खोलियो, भित्री भाग निकालियो, र पेटको भित्री भाग निकालियो। फलस्वरूप, पेटको गुहा खाली गरियो। सेफ्ट्रियाक्सोन, पोलिमिक्सिन, एमिकेकेन, र भ्यान्कोमाइसिन एन्टिबायोटिक प्रयोग गरेर उपचार गरियो।

answer: प्रस्तुतिले "कानमा द्विपक्षीय फोका" को वर्णन गर्‍यो र आवश्यक "१२/१६ को कठिन पातलोपन" को वर्णन गर्‍यो।

question: के उसलाई अस्पताल लगिँदै छ? के ऊ कोरोना भाइरसबाट बिरामी छ?
answer: टाउकोमा चोट लागेको, नाडी भाँचिएको र पानीको कमीले गर्दा तपाईंको स्वास्थ्य बिग्रियो, त्यसैले तपाईंलाई अर्को अस्पतालमा सारियो। तर, तपाईंको कोरोनाभाइरस पीसीआर परीक्षणको नतिजा नेगेटिभ आयो।

question: त्यो रोगको लागि मैले कहिले औषधि खान सुरु गर्नुपर्छ?
answer: Carbapenem-resistant clabyssiella infections are treated with polymyxins, amikacin, and metronidazole.

question: मेरो कतिवटा अपोइन्टमेन्टहरू बाँकी छन्?
answer: तपाईंको इलेक्ट्रोएन्सेफलोग्राफीको लागि फलो-अप अपोइन्टमेन्ट 12/01/2020 मा र फ्याट परामर्शको लागि आउट पेशेन्ट परामर्शको लागि 10/11/2020 मा छ। तपाईंले आफ्नो फिजियोथेरापी र पोषण टोलीको निर्देशनहरू पनि पालना गर्नुपर्छ।
